Interface ec.encoding.Decodable

public interface interface Decodable
This interface is for objects which are interested in taking control of their own decoding from a comm system. It is merely a marker interface in that it declares no methods, but that is because Java doesn't let you declare requirements for static methods. In particular, a Decodable must declare a method of the form:
static DecodeResult decode (Object prefaceArgs[]);
This method is called on the class returned from EncodedObject.getEncodedClass(). Subsequently, the returned DecodeResult is asked to decodeBody() on the body args from the same EncodedObject. There are two standard implementations of DecodeResult: A StopDecoding takes the final object on construction and merely returns it when asked to decodeBody(). A ContinueDecoding may be returned from a StandardDecodable's decode() method, and its decodeBody() merely relays the call to the StandardDecodable. Classes may also choose to use any other implementation of DecodeResult if they need special behavior.

See Also:
ContinueDecoding, EncodedObject, DecodeResult, StandardDecodable, StopDecoding
